CatDescriptText: Kenneth Smythe, graduate math student, Hill Districe and D.W. Graham, railroad worker, Terrace Village, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, September 10, 1960, pg. A1 with question "Do you read daily and weekly newspapers and magazines regularly?  Do you think they present the news, etc., fairly and objectively, or do you believe that they are influenced in their presentation? If you believe the latter, who or what do you think influences the presentation?"  Mr. Smythe's answer reads: "In the majority of the cases, I think they do a good job.  Somethimes they are unfair because o fthe attempt for sensationalism."  Mr. Graham's answer reads: "Yes, I think both present news pretty fair.  Some magazines I read are very helpful.  I have no criticism for eighter newspapers or magazines because I think they are fairly accurate."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Kenneth Smyth wearing small patterned button down collared shirt, standing in front of KQV studio, Smithfield Street, Downtown; Portrait of D.W. Graham wearing light colored button down collared shirt and eyeglasses, standing in front of store
